body_html:
The best thing to do would be to split this test into more manageable pieces, or even better, make it faster (less iterations, etc., if such a thing is still possible). On Wed, Feb 1, 2017 at 10:56 AM, Yuan (Terry) Tang <notifications@github.com
…
wrote: Okay...should I change this to manual? Let me know what's the correct way to do it. I think it's better to document the best practices somewhere to avoid this back and forth conversation. On Wed, Feb 1, 2017 at 12:50 PM, gunan ***@***.***> wrote: > No, please do not use sharding, they can cause even worse complications > with testinfra. Id rather we just disable this test. > > Large tests have 15 minute timeouts, and build phase added on top of that > takes them out of our goals for presubmit time limits. Therefore we > conciously disable large tests in our testinfra. > > On Feb 1, 2017 10:44 AM, "Shanqing Cai" ***@***.***> wrote: > > > @terrytangyuan <https://github.com/terrytangyuan> You are right. The > test > > failures may be due to a BUILD file format requirement. Can you move the > > shard_count line after srcs and before srcs_version. > > > > — > > You are receiving this because you were mentioned. > > Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub > > <https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/pull/ > 7180#issuecomment-276743212>, > > or mute the thread > > <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/ > AHlCOcVdKp55mFcvCyUKpIn6doJhFc49ks5rYNJ5gaJpZM4Lzd3N> > > > . > > > > — > You are receiving this because you were mentioned. > Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub > <https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/pull/ 7180#issuecomment-276745075>, > or mute the thread > <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/ AEEnSor6B6cNjoL8NAyV1XJMpU-lncNuks5rYNQRgaJpZM4Lzd3N> > . > — You are receiving this because you were mentioned. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <#7180 (comment)>, or mute the thread <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AAjO_TYMocotuTUixZB3Ejb4x9Xpv4l0ks5rYNVfgaJpZM4Lzd3N> .
body_text:
The best thing to do would be to split this test into more manageable
pieces, or even better, make it faster (less iterations, etc., if such a
thing is still possible).

On Wed, Feb 1, 2017 at 10:56 AM, Yuan (Terry) Tang <notifications@github.com
…
 wrote:
 Okay...should I change this to manual? Let me know what's the correct way
 to do it. I think it's better to document the best practices somewhere to
 avoid this back and forth conversation.

 On Wed, Feb 1, 2017 at 12:50 PM, gunan ***@***.***> wrote:

 > No, please do not use sharding, they can cause even worse complications
 > with testinfra. Id rather we just disable this test.
 >
 > Large tests have 15 minute timeouts, and build phase added on top of that
 > takes them out of our goals for presubmit time limits. Therefore we
 > conciously disable large tests in our testinfra.
 >
 > On Feb 1, 2017 10:44 AM, "Shanqing Cai" ***@***.***>
 wrote:
 >
 > > @terrytangyuan <https://github.com/terrytangyuan> You are right. The
 > test
 > > failures may be due to a BUILD file format requirement. Can you move
 the
 > > shard_count line after srcs and before srcs_version.
 > >
 > > —
 > > You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
 > > Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
 > > <https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/pull/
 > 7180#issuecomment-276743212>,
 > > or mute the thread
 > > <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/
 > AHlCOcVdKp55mFcvCyUKpIn6doJhFc49ks5rYNJ5gaJpZM4Lzd3N>
 >
 > > .
 > >
 >
 > —
 > You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
 > Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
 > <https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/pull/
 7180#issuecomment-276745075>,
 > or mute the thread
 > <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/
 AEEnSor6B6cNjoL8NAyV1XJMpU-lncNuks5rYNQRgaJpZM4Lzd3N>

 > .
 >

 —
 You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
 Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
 <#7180 (comment)>,
 or mute the thread
 <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AAjO_TYMocotuTUixZB3Ejb4x9Xpv4l0ks5rYNVfgaJpZM4Lzd3N>
 .
body:
The best thing to do would be to split this test into more manageable
pieces, or even better, make it faster (less iterations, etc., if such a
thing is still possible).

On Wed, Feb 1, 2017 at 10:56 AM, Yuan (Terry) Tang <notifications@github.com
> wrote:

> Okay...should I change this to manual? Let me know what's the correct way
> to do it. I think it's better to document the best practices somewhere to
> avoid this back and forth conversation.
>
> On Wed, Feb 1, 2017 at 12:50 PM, gunan <notifications@github.com> wrote:
>
> > No, please do not use sharding, they can cause even worse complications
> > with testinfra. Id rather we just disable this test.
> >
> > Large tests have 15 minute timeouts, and build phase added on top of that
> > takes them out of our goals for presubmit time limits. Therefore we
> > conciously disable large tests in our testinfra.
> >

> wrote:

> > test
> > > failures may be due to a BUILD file format requirement. Can you move
> the
> > > shard_count line after srcs and before srcs_version.
